title: Internal compiler error while decoding cache

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
### Code I'm not sure if it's related to the code I've written since I've pushed everything on my [repository](https://github.com/antoninhrlt/linbra/tree/1ba0aecc314222da049ab82fdba2189999195cb2) then cloned it in another directory, ran `cargo build` and the bug did not occur. I also copied and pasted my local folder and ran `cargo build` but the bug still does not occur again. However, in the original folder, the error persists. It seems to be related to the cache because the error is thrown at [compiler/rustc_query_impl/src/on_disk_cache.rs:717:40](https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/master/compiler/rustc_query_impl/src/on_disk_cache.rs#L717). The bug only occurs with my `stable` version, not in `nightly` nor `beta`. ### Meta `rustc --version --verbose`: ``` rustc 1.68.0 (2c8cc3432 2023-03-06) binary: rustc commit-hash: 2c8cc343237b8f7d5a3c3703e3a87f2eb2c54a74 commit-date: 2023-03-06 host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu release: 1.68.0 LLVM version: 15.0.6 ``` ### Error output ``` thread 'rustc' panicked at 'index out of bounds: the len is 112 but the index is 112', compiler/rustc_query_impl/src/on_disk_cache.rs:717:40 note: run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=1` environment variable to display a backtrace error: internal compiler error: unexpected panic note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug. note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/new?labels=C-bug%2C+I-ICE%2C+T-compiler&template=ice.md note: rustc 1.68.0 (2c8cc3432 2023-03-06) running on x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu note: compiler flags: --crate-type lib -C embed-bitcode=no -C debuginfo=2 -C incremental=[REDACTED] note: some of the compiler flags provided by cargo are hidden query stack during panic: thread 'rustc' panicked at 'Illegal read of: 756', /rustc/2c8cc343237b8f7d5a3c3703e3a87f2eb2c54a74/compiler/rustc_query_system/src/dep_graph/graph.rs:447:25 stack backtrace: 0: 0x7f6e2116659a - std::backtrace_rs::backtrace::trace_unsynchronized::h177a0149c76cdde9 at /rustc/2c8cc343237b8f7d5a3c3703e3a87f2eb2c54a74/library/std/src/../../backtrace/src/backtrace/mod.rs:66:5 2: 0x7f6e2116659a - std::sys_common::backtrace::_print_fmt::hc0701fd2c3530c58 at /rustc/2c8cc343237b8f7d5a3c3703e3a87f2eb2c54a74/library/std/src/sys_common/backtrace.rs:65:5 3: 0x7f6e2116659a - ``` stack backtrace: 0: rust_begin_unwind at /rustc/2c8cc343237b8f7d5a3c3703e3a87f2eb2c54a74/library/std/src/panicking.rs:575:5 1: core::panicking::panic_fmt at /rustc/2c8cc343237b8f7d5a3c3703e3a87f2eb2c54a74/library/core/src/panicking.rs:64:14 2: core::panicking::panic_bounds_check at /rustc/2c8cc343237b8f7d5a3c3703e3a87f2eb2c54a74/library/core/src/panicking.rs:159:5 3: >::decode 4: rustc_query_system::query::plumbing::get_query:: 5: rustc_ty_utils::ty::param_env 6: >::with_task:: 7: rustc_query_system::query::plumbing::get_query:: 8: rustc_hir_typeck::typeck_const_arg 9: >::with_task:: 10: rustc_query_system::query::plumbing::try_execute_query:: 11: ::typeck_const_arg 12: rustc_hir_typeck::typeck 13: >::with_task:: 14: rustc_query_system::query::plumbing::try_execute_query:: 15: rustc_data_structures::sync::par_for_each_in::<&[rustc_span::def_id::LocalDefId], ::par_body_owners::{closure#0}> 16: rustc_hir_typeck::typeck_item_bodies 17: >::with_task:: 18: rustc_query_system::query::plumbing::try_execute_query:: 19: ::typeck_item_bodies 20: ::time::<(), rustc_hir_analysis::check_crate::{closure#7}> 21: rustc_hir_analysis::check_crate 22: rustc_interface::passes::analysis 23: >::with_task::> 24: rustc_query_system::query::plumbing::try_execute_query:: 25: ::analysis 26: ::enter::> 27: rustc_span::with_source_map::, rustc_interface::interface::run_compiler, rustc_driver::run_compiler::{closure#1}>::{closure#0}::{closure#0}> 28: >::set::, rustc_driver::run_compiler::{closure#1}>::{closure#0}, core::result::Result<(), rustc_errors::ErrorGuaranteed>> note: Some details are omitted, run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=full` for a verbose backtrace. ```
